00013 #ifndef __MLPACK_CORE_MATH_RANDOM_HPP
00014 #define __MLPACK_CORE_MATH_RANDOM_HPP

00016 #include <mlpack/prereqs.hpp>
00017 #include <boost/random.hpp>

00019 namespace mlpack {
00020 namespace math  {
00021 
00022 // Annoying Boost versioning issues.
00023 #include <boost/version.hpp>
00024 
00025 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 104700
00026   // Global random object.
00027   extern boost::random::mt19937 randGen;
00028   // Global uniform distribution.
00029   extern boost::random::uniform_01<> randUniformDist;
00030   // Global normal distribution.
00031   extern boost::random::normal_distribution<> randNormalDist;
00032 #else
00033   // Global random object.
00034   extern boost::mt19937 randGen;
00035 
00036   #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00037     // Global uniform distribution.
00038     extern boost::uniform_01<> randUniformDist;
00039   #else
00040     // Pre-1.39 Boost.Random did not give default template parameter values.
00041     extern boost::uniform_01<boost::mt19937, double> randUniformDist;
00042   #endif
00043 
00044   // Global normal distribution.
00045   extern boost::normal_distribution<> randNormalDist;
00046 #endif
00047 
00055 inline void RandomSeed(const size_t seed)
00056 {
00057   randGen.seed((uint32_t) seed);
00058   srand((unsigned int) seed);
00059 #if ARMA_VERSION_MAJOR > 3 || \
00060     (ARMA_VERSION_MAJOR == 3 && ARMA_VERSION_MINOR >= 930)
00061   // Armadillo >= 3.930 has its own random number generator internally that we
00062   // need to set the seed for also.
00063   arma::arma_rng::set_seed(seed);
00064 #endif
00065 }
00066 
00070 inline double Random()
00071 {
00072 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00073   return randUniformDist(randGen);
00074 #else
00075   // Before Boost 1.39, we did not give the random object when we wanted a
00076   // random number; that gets given at construction time.
00077   return randUniformDist();
00078 #endif
00079 }
00080 
00084 inline double Random(const double lo, const double hi)
00085 {
00086 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00087   return lo + (hi - lo) * randUniformDist(randGen);
00088 #else
00089   // Before Boost 1.39, we did not give the random object when we wanted a
00090   // random number; that gets given at construction time.
00091   return lo + (hi - lo) * randUniformDist();
00092 #endif
00093 }
00094 
00098 inline int RandInt(const int hiExclusive)
00099 {
00100 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00101   return (int) std::floor((double) hiExclusive * randUniformDist(randGen));
00102 #else
00103   // Before Boost 1.39, we did not give the random object when we wanted a
00104   // random number; that gets given at construction time.
00105   return (int) std::floor((double) hiExclusive * randUniformDist());
00106 #endif
00107 }
00108 
00112 inline int RandInt(const int lo, const int hiExclusive)
00113 {
00114 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00115   return lo + (int) std::floor((double) (hiExclusive - lo)
00116                                * randUniformDist(randGen));
00117 #else
00118   // Before Boost 1.39, we did not give the random object when we wanted a
00119   // random number; that gets given at construction time.
00120   return lo + (int) std::floor((double) (hiExclusive - lo)
00121                                * randUniformDist());
00122 #endif
00123 
00124 }
00125 
00129 inline double RandNormal()
00130 {
00131   return randNormalDist(randGen);
00132 }
00133 
00141 inline double RandNormal(const double mean, const double variance)
00142 {
00143   return variance * randNormalDist(randGen) + mean;
00144 }
